Sequence Information.Peptide Name: mBD-3 (murine beta defensin-3, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; animals; 3S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: epithelia, respiratory system and other mucosal surfaces, mouse,Mus musculus

Literature Information.Literature: Murine homolog of HBD-2.Recombinant production:insects: Recombinant mBD-3 peptide, produced from a baculovirus cell expression system, showed antimicrobial activity against P. aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC 8 um/ml) and E. coli D31 (MIC 16 ug/ml) in a salt-sensitive manner (see the ref).Host expression:induced: pathogen inducible. mBD-3 appears to play a role in mucosal immunity in the lower urinary tract(Becknell B et al. 2014IL-17A and IL-17F are essential for the production of mBD-3 to clear S. aureus nasal colonization (Archer NK et al., 2016).Activity: synthetic mBD-3 inhibited the growth of E. coli, P. aeruginosa, S. aureus, and C. albicans at concentrations from 25 to 50 microg/mL (Burd RS et al 2002).Updated 4/2014; 10/2016; 3/2017; Jan2024.
Literature Information.Author: Bals R1, Wang X, Meegalla RL, Wattler S, Weiner DJ, Nehls MC, Wilson JM.1999
Literature Information.Title: Mouse beta-defensin 3 is an inducible antimicrobial peptide expressed in the epithelia of multiple organs.
